template.name: Template Module Cisco CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB version: 0.15 MIBs used: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB

discovery_rule.name: Memory Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoMemoryPoolTable, a table of memory pool monitoring entries. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Used memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently in use by applications on the managed device. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Available memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-MEMORY-POOL-MIB Indicates the number of bytes from the memory pool that are currently unused on the managed device. Note that the sum of ciscoMemoryPoolUsed and ciscoMemoryPoolFree is the total amount of memory in the pool Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15216-contiguous-memory.html

template.name: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB version: 0.15 MIBs used: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB The cpmCPUTotal5minRev MIB object provides a more accurate view of the performance of the router over time than the MIB objects cpmCPUTotal1minRev and cpmCPUTotal5secRev . These MIB objects are not accurate because they look at CPU at one minute and five second intervals, respectively. These MIBs enable you to monitor the trends and plan the capacity of your network. The recommended baseline rising threshold for cpmCPUTotal5minRev is 90 percent. Depending on the platform, some routers that run at 90 percent, for example, 2500s, can exhibit performance degradation versus a high-end router, for example, the 7500 series, which can operate fine. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

template.template: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB IOS versions 12.0_3_T-12.2_3.5 SNMPv2
template.name: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB IOS versions 12.0_3_T-12.2_3.5 SNMPv2
template.description: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB IOS versions 12.0_3_T-12.2_3.5 version: 0.15 MIBs used: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period. This object deprecates the avgBusy5 object from the OLD-CISCO-SYSTEM-MIB. This object is deprecated by cpmCPUTotal5minRev which has the changed range of value (0..100) Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

item.host: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB IOS versions 12.0_3_T-12.2_3.5 SNMPv2

template.name: Template Module Cisco OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB version: 0.15 MIBs used: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB 5 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

template.name: Template Module Cisco Inventory SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco Inventory version: 0.15 MIBs used: ENTITY-MIB

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Cisco Inventory SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Module Cisco Inventory SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

template.name: Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB version: 0.15 MIBs used: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoEnvMonTemperatureTable (ciscoEnvMonTemperatureDescr), a table of ambient temperature status maintained by the environmental monitor.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current measurement of the test point being instrumented.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current state of the test point being instrumented.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:""}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:""}

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:""}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:"critical"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:"shutdown"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_WARN_STATUS:"warning"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_WARN_STATUS:"notFunctioning"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

dependency.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
dependency.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:"critical"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.psu.status[ciscoEnvMonSupplyState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:"shutdown"},eq)}=1

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of fan status maintained by the environmental monitor.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:"critical"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:"shutdown"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_WARN_STATUS:"warning"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_WARN_STATUS:"notFunctioning"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

dependency.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state
dependency.expression: {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:"critical"},eq)}=1 or {Template Module Cisco CISCO-ENVMON-MIB SNMPv2:sensor.fan.status[ciscoEnvMonFanState.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:"shutdown"},eq)}=1

template.name: Template Net Cisco IOS SNMPv2
template.description: Template Cisco IOS Software releases 12.2(3.5) or later version: 0.15 Known Issues: description : no if(in|out)(Errors|Discards) are available for vlan ifType version : IOS for example: 12.1(22)EA11, 15.4(3)M2 device : C2911, C7600

template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases later to 12.0(3)T and prior to 12.2(3.5) version: 0.15

template.name: Template Module Cisco CISCO-PROCESS-MIB IOS versions 12.0_3_T-12.2_3.5 SNMPv2

template.name: Template Net Cisco IOS prior to 12.0_3_T SNMPv2
template.description: Cisco IOS Software releases prior to 12.0(3)T version: 0.15

trigger.expression: {Template Module Cisco Inventory SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Module Cisco Inventory SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close
